title: Bootable Utilities Image 2.2.0
description:
WHAT IS IT?
Many operations require you to "unmount" your hard drive or partition such as:  Fixing, Optimizing, Defragmenting, Partitioning, Cloning and Data Recovery. There are many great tools to do these functions, but to use them you either need a second operating system installed or a bunch of bootable discs. To make your life easier I have compiled a bootable image which contains as many of these tools as possible. This image can be burnt to a DVD or cloned to a iPod/flash USB stick/hard drive/partition; the resulting product will then be bootable. Bootable Utilities Image(BUI) is entirely universal--meaning it will work with intel and PPC macintosh computers--it is also entirely Leopard compatible. 

Note that the image itself now runs Leopard (10.5.6).

What's included?
Carbon Copy Cloner 3.2.1
Clone X 3.2.0
CopyCatX 4.0
Data Rescue II 1.2.2
Disk Utility 11.1
DiskWarrior 4.1.1
Drive Genius 2.1.1
FileSalvage 6.1.7
Firmware Password Utility 1.4.3
iDefrag 1.6.8
iPartition 3.1.1
MacForensicsLab 2.5.3
MemTest 4.22
OfficeSalvage 6.1.5
Preview 4.2 
RescuePRO 3.3.0.0
SpeedTools 2.8
Startup Disk 1.4
TechTool Pro 5.0.4
Terminal 2.0.2
TestDisk 6.11.3
TextMate 1.5.8
VolumeWorks 1.5 

Newsletter: Not a newsletter per say, but sign up and receive updates about this project. 

Support Page: http://www.dostuffright.com/BUI 

COMMENTS: 
There is no update kit for this version. The reason for that is the core itself has been updated. I always try to save you bandwidth when I can, so please be understanding. 
TechTool Pro will ask you to update the TechTool Protection when it first loads; just hit cancel. Also, some of the options in TechTool Pro just don't work. I don't have a working copy from Micromat, so I can't make one for you. 
OfficeSalvage might not be working properly. If you need to recover data I would recommend using Data Rescue.
